subject: Re: How to log JUnits Tests
msgSnippet: You can call your unit tests from Ant. Ant allows you to create reports from your unit test runs. Info on how to run JUnit from Ant:
messageBody:
You can call your unit tests from Ant.
Ant allows you to create reports from your unit test runs.
Info on how to run JUnit from Ant:
http://ant.apache.org/manual/OptionalTasks/junit.html
Info on how to generate a report:
http://ant.apache.org/manual/OptionalTasks/junitreport.html

Regards, Jan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "isowitz" <isowitz@...> wrote:
>
> I have a problem with logging JUnit tests. In a package I have a
> AllTests class that calls several tests. The result of that tests
> should be logged.
> I'm not familiar with JUnit or logging so I try to find examples in
the
> web. Unfortunately i found no examples or hints for me.
>
> How do you log your JUnit results?
>
